info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 31 at 3:42PM EDT until July 31 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northern Maryland, including the following county, Baltimore.
* WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 340 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing. with some roads in the Joppatowne area closed due to flooding. Honeygo Run near Whitemarsh if in moderate flood stage, with flooding ongoing along the run. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen.
- Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Middle River... Carney... Perry Hall... Rossville... White Marsh... Nottingham... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
